sections.MISSION: 3/2 Wolfpack conducts M4 Marskmanship training over TW9 (27NOV-01DEC) and TW10 (04-08DEC) within GTA range complex to increase individual Trooper lethality in key tactical skill level 1
sections.PURPOSE: of this operation is to maximize eligible Trooper participation in CONSKILLS course to increase lethality in combined arms maneuver. .
sections.KEY TASKS:
​
Develop and rehearse program of instruction for each CONSKILLS courses
Certify all instructors with Wolf 6 and 7
Maximize live fire and hands on training day and night
Develop new TTPs / SOPs across the Squadron ​
sections.END STATE: Eligible Wolfpack Troopers participate in at least 1x CONSKILLS course and all new SOPs are captured in Wolfpack TACSOP. ​
sections.CONCEPT OF OPERATION: s. This operation will be conducted in four phases. Phase I: Planning, Phase II: POI Development & Instructor Certification, Phase III:

Marksmanship Course (5 Days)
​Who: Anybody
Attendee cap: 50
Trainers: 10
C2: Lightning What: M4 marksmanship skills & LFX 5 day course Prereq – Zero and qualified on M4
When: TW9 (27NOV-01DEC) & TW10(04-08DEC) 2x Courses
Where: M4 zero range/25m flat range, EST Sim center, KD range, Record fire range, small arms familiarization range (Rg 310)
Why: Increase individual M4 rifle marksmanship & proficiency Training Objectives:
Zero on Optics, boresighting, theory of marksmanship (classroom)
Confirm zero at distance
SRM/CQB table
Barrier/Nonstandard platform shooting
Stress Shoot
CBRN equipment shooting
Maximize night shooting opportunities (PEQ shooting)
Primary Instructor: SSG Carter Wegner
Ammo Support
Marksmanship Waterfall

draw.mission_task_and_description: 3/2CR Squadron M4 Marksmanship stress shoot at Range 310 on 01DEC23 and Range 101 on 08DEC23.

values: Soldiers will maintain muzzle awareness and safeties will clear their weapons after execution.
the proper weapon control status determined by unit leadership
SDZs will be planned ICW 7th ATC and Range Control.
Safeties will follow firers behind ensuring safe manipulation of their weapons and sequence of events.
The two lanes for the stress shoot are mirrored in order to separate firers as much as possible
Firers will start at the same time per iteration
Engineer tape will clearly mark the route and the shooting platforms will be clearly defined.
All firers will be qualified on their assigned weapon systems prior to execution.
Leaders will identify targets and mark left and right limits of sectors of fire
Major injuries will be coordinated with Range Control IOT transport casualties to AXP.
OIC/RSO and safeties will enforce safety standards. Medical personnel will be briefed on MEDEVAC procedures IAW Range Control's medical SOP.
Prior to execution, troops will receive a brief on the approved SDZ and locations of Range fans on Range 310 and 123.
Range orientation brief during daily range safety brief by RSO.
Range fans clearly marked and visible.
Weapon systems properly cleared before leaving the firing line.
Range orientation brief from the OIC/RSO prior to training, identify range fans before each iteration.
RSO/ OIC Range Safeties VCEs Vehicle Crew

subtasks.hazard: Negligent Discharge or Weapon Malfunction Causing Bodily Harm

values: required PPE while on the range.
Lane safeties and the OIC / RSO will ensure weapon systems are properly oriented downrange and operating in a safe manner at all times.
Weapons will be visual cleared by RSO following completion of the lane.
All weapons will be inspected by SL/ PSG prior to moving to any range.
Weapons will be pointed downrange at all times away from personnel when loaded.
Ensure a Medic and a dedicated evacuation vehicle (FLA) is available at all times.
PMI Conduct safety brief prior to each range TC and VC Physically inspect to ensure manual safe is engaged Conduct clearing procedure in accordance with TM
RSO/ OIC Range Safeties Vehicle Crew
posted at all entry points to the range and at high traffic areas.
Brief all participants to immediately report potential unauthorized access on the Range or in the live fire area to the OIC and RSO.
Range Safety Brief Task to Troops OIC/RSO Supervision

subtask.name: MOVEMENT TO, FROM, AND ON TRAINING SITE

values: vehicle PMCS prior to movement, all Soldier's will adhere to posted speed limit signs, drive
Ground guides will be used when maneuvering all vehicles onto the range.
Sleeping areas will be marked with Chem lights and engineer tape. Soldiers will not sleep next to any vehicle.
Ground guides will be used entering and exiting motor pools.
Use of proper hand and arm signals when maneuvering all vehicles.
Conduct safety brief at each phase, addressing: speed, route, and vehicle safety

subtask.name: MOVEMENT TO, FROM, AND ON TRAINING SITE

values: Brief crews on procedures during limited visibility conditions.
Soldiers will use NODs, DVEs, and RWS FLIR during limited visibility and night time operations.
White light will be use when conducting admin moves.
Ground guides will be used during times of degraded visibility.
PCCs and PCIs Brief limited visibility conditions during safety brief.

subtasks.hazard: Combustions / Fire at the ammo point

values: least two 10 pound fire extinguishers on hand.
No smoking withing 50m of ammo point
Ammo will be stored in accordance with QUASAS Range OPS, and 2CR policy.
Ammo point inspected by RSO and OIC
Use of snow chains when snow and ice are on the ground.
Reduce vehicle speed based on road condition
Use of ground guides and chem lights during poor visibility due to weather.
If lightning is in the immediate area all personnel will move to the nearest grounded hard stand structure or spread out in low ground away from all equipment.
Ensure Soldiers know how toi nstall snow chains properly. Brief inclement weather condition and safety measures during safety brief
Brief all Soldiers on procedure when finding a UXO.
Clear the area surrounding the UXO.
Mark UXO, call EOD and Range Operations.
OIC will monitor temperature and humidity of ground surface.
Verify fire danger posted by Range Operation daily.
Identify fire team and have appropriate FFE on-hand and ready.
OIC will place range in "DRY" status and notify Range Operation.
Range OIC/RSO will monitor the weather and change the uniform accordingly.

subtasks.hazard: Trauma wounds from sim-round shot, ricochet, or loss of consciousness due to tripping or cold injury

values: Leaders will monitor the health and condition of their Soliders and initiate medical care in the event of noticing injuries or symptoms.
Safeties are alert and mindful of Soldiers condition.

draw.overall_supervision_plan: The OIC, RSO, and range leadership will conduct a range safety brief prior to all live fire training. The OIC and RSO are overall responsible for safety. However, safeties, instructors, and VCs have the responsibility to be actively engaged in range activities and Soldier actions so as to mitigate risk at the lowest level possible and ensure overall safety for the training event. There will be two safeties per shooter. One that will be right behind the shooter making sure that the fundamentals of safety are followed and the other that will be maintain wider situational awareness while grading.
